title: V26 QUANTUM REALITY frontend overwrite (Singularity entry, Hyper-Reality feed, HUD overlays, Architect mode)

requirements.summary: Fully overwrite AppV1.jsx with the user-provided V26 QUANTUM REALITY app UI implementation.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` content is replaced in full by the user-provided V26 code (not merged into the old V25 code).
The application boots through the existing `frontend/src/App.tsx` wrapper and renders the V26 UI.

file_operations.description: Replace the entire file contents with the exact V26 “QUANTUM REALITY” code provided by the user (full overwrite; no partial merge). Ensure the exported component remains compatible with the existing `frontend/src/App.tsx` thin wrapper.

requirements.summary: Apply minimal mechanical fixes so the V26 overwrite compiles and runs in this repository without changing intended UX.
acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or equivalent CI build) succeeds without TypeScript/ESLint blocking errors introduced by the pasted code.
All referenced symbols in `AppV1.jsx` resolve (e.g., any dataset constant used to initialize state such as `INITIAL_SALONS` is defined consistently with the provided `DATA`).
No changes are made to immutable frontend entry files; `frontend/src/App.tsx` remains a thin wrapper rendering `AppV1`.

file_operations.description: Fix only mechanical/runtime issues introduced by the pasted V26 code (e.g., missing imports, undefined identifiers/constants, invalid JSX, event handler typings/guards, missing default exports) while preserving the intended V26 layout, styling, copy, and interaction behavior.

Add/adjust only the minimal global CSS utilities/animations required by the V26 code to compile and render correctly (e.g., any referenced animation class names or keyframes) without altering intended visuals beyond what the V26 code expects.

requirements.summary: Implement/verify the V26 Singularity Entry long-press gate with aspiration-style transition into the experience.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: holding mouse down charges progress; releasing early resets progress to 0.
On mobile: holding touch charges progress; releasing early resets progress to 0.
When progress reaches 100%, the UI transitions into the next view with a clear ‘aspiration’/pull-in animation (not an abrupt cut).

file_operations.description: Ensure the V26 Singularity Entry screen supports sustained press for both mouse and touch (press-to-charge, release-to-reset), and triggers a non-abrupt aspiration/pull-in transition when the progress completes.

Add/adjust any required animation utilities used by the V26 Singularity Entry aspiration transition (e.g., keyframes/classes referenced by the V26 UI) to ensure the transition is visibly animated rather than a hard cut.

requirements.summary: Implement/verify the V26 Hyper-Reality full-screen feed with spring-like transitions and scroll-tied image zoom.
acceptanceCriteria: In the client feed, each salon card occupies a full viewport presentation (one salon per screen, scroll to advance).
Transitions/scroll between items feel spring-based (Framer Motion spring config is used for the primary movement).
As the user scrolls through the feed, the active salon image applies a slight zoom effect tied to scroll (not just hover).

file_operations.description: Ensure the V26 feed renders salons as full-viewport windows and that navigation/scroll progression uses spring-like motion (using a spring configuration for primary movement as per V26 intent). Tie active salon image zoom subtly to scroll/progress (not hover-only).

requirements.summary: Implement/verify the V26 HUD frosted-glass overlays with hover reaction on desktop and touch-friendly usability.
acceptanceCriteria: HUD information panels use a frosted-glass style (backdrop blur + translucent fill + subtle border).
On hover-capable devices, panels show a noticeable hover reaction (e.g., opacity/brightness/border accent/blur shift).
On touch devices, the HUD remains readable and does not require hover to access essential info.

file_operations.description: Ensure the V26 HUD overlay panels (bio/price/contact) render as frosted-glass surfaces, include a clear hover reaction where supported, and remain fully readable/usable on touch devices without relying on hover-only interactions.
Add/adjust any global CSS utilities needed for the V26 HUD frosted-glass effect and hover reactions (e.g., subtle borders, blur helpers, transitions) if referenced by the V26 code.

requirements.summary: Implement/verify the V26 Architect (Creator) mode: cyber-futuristic creator UI with live revenue simulation and instant Setup/Preview dimension switch.
acceptanceCriteria: Revenue simulation updates immediately when services are added/edited (no manual refresh).
A visible Setup/Preview toggle exists and switches instantly between editing and previewing the created salon experience.
Publishing/finishing the creator flow injects the new salon into the in-memory salon list immediately (local-only demo behavior; no backend calls).

file_operations.description: Ensure the V26 creator flow provides: (1) a cyber-futuristic creator UI, (2) a real-time revenue simulator that updates immediately as services change, (3) an instant Setup ↔ Preview dimension toggle, and (4) a local-only publish/finish action that injects the new salon into the in-memory list without any backend calls.
